intro: Hieracium amaurocymum, commonly known as the black-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dark purple to black central flower heads surrounded by yellow ray florets, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Hieracium amaurocymum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
